class rcm.lambdautils.DistTypes.DT_Wolf(name: str = 'Empty', p1: float | None = None, p2: float | None = None)

Bases: DistType

Lambda channel spacing based on Wolf’s notes

(ask Anthony Sciola or Frank Toffoletto for a copy)

With the addition that there can be 2 p values for the start and end, and pStar transitions between them

genAlams(n, amin, amax, kmin=0, kmax=-1)

class rcm.lambdautils.DistTypes.DistType(name: str = 'Empty')

Bases: object

name: str = 'Empty'
class rcm.lambdautils.DistTypes.ValueSpec(start: float, end: float, scaleType: str, n: int | NoneType = None, c: float | NoneType = None)

Bases: object

c: float | None = None

c has different meanings depending on scaleType lin: If given, will use set spacing c log: If given, will use log of base c spacing_lin: If given, will use as Sum_{k=1}^{N} c*k, where N is calculated based on start, end, and c

end: float
eval(doEnd)
n: int | None = None
scaleType: str
start: float
rcm.lambdautils.DistTypes.conditional_decorator(dec, dataclasses_json_module_imported)
rcm.lambdautils.DistTypes.getDistTypeFromKwargs(**kwargs)

This takes a set of kwargs and, using a present ‘name’ key, decides which DistType implementation they belong to And then returns an object of that DistType
